recipes.title: Traditional Gluten Free Potato Salad

extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 stalks chopped celery, minced (or minced dill pickles or sweet relish, to taste)
extendedIngredients.name: celery

extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 teaspoon ground white pepper, or more to taste
extendedIngredients.name: ground pepper

extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 7/8 cups mayonnaise (some brands/varieties contain corn and those containing vinegar contain yeast)
extendedIngredients.name: mayonnaise
metaInformation: (some brands/varieties contain corn and those containing vinegar contain yeast)

extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 1/2 Tablespoons gluten-free mustard (French's or Grey Poupon)
extendedIngredients.name: mustard

extendedIngredients.originalString: 8 lbs. potatoes, peeled and cut into 3/4-inch cubes
extendedIngredients.name: potatoes

extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 teaspoon fine sea salt, or more to taste
extendedIngredients.name: sea salt

extendedIngredients.originalString: 5 1/2 Tablespoons distilled white vinegar (or cider vinegar if corn intolerant)
extendedIngredients.name: white distilled vinegar

extendedIngredients.originalString: 7 Tablespoons minced yellow or red onion
extendedIngredients.name: yellow onion

steps.step: Add potatoes to a large pot of water and bring to a boil; and boil for 13 - 15 minutes.
Drain in a colander and set atop a bowl. Refrigerate to drain and cool completely cool. Set the pot aside for later use.

Place eggs in a saucepan in a single layer; bring to a boil; and boil for 12 minutes. Prepare an ice bath (bowl of water with one-quarter ice). Using a slotted spoon, transfer the hard-boiled eggs to the ice bath bowl. Crack each shell in one place allowing water to run under the shell. Under running water, remove the shells and discard them. Refrigerate the whole eggs until cold. Once cool, using two steak knives, mince/chop the eggs and set back in the refrigerator.To the original pot in which you boiled the potatoes, add the potatoes, eggs, celery, and parsley.

Whisk the mayonnaise, mustard, vinegar, onion, salt, and pepper together and pour two-thirds on top of everything in the pot.Using a large, rubber or plastic spoon, carefully fold everything together.
Add the remaining sauce a little at a time, and season with additional salt, pepper, and vinegar, to taste.

recipes.title: Melt-in-Your-Mouth Chocolate Cake

extendedIngredients.originalString: 200 grams (7 ounces) high-quality bittersweet chocolate, roughly chopped
extendedIngredients.name: bittersweet chocolate

extendedIngredients.originalString: 200 grams (1 cup minus 2 tablespoons) unsalted butter, diced (substitute almond butter or coconut oil to make this dairy-free)
extendedIngredients.name: butter
metaInformation: (substitute almond butter or coconut oil to make this dairy-free)

extendedIngredients.originalString: 180 grams (1 cup minus 2 tablespoons) unrefined blond cane sugar
extendedIngredients.name: cane sugar

extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 rounded tablespoon flour (all-purpose or other, including any gluten-free flour; can be omitted altogether to make this grain-free)
extendedIngredients.name: gluten-free flour
metaInformation: ( or other, including any flour; can be omitted altogether to make this grain-free)

extendedIngredients.originalString: fleur de sel or kosher salt, for sprinkling
extendedIngredients.name: kosher salt

steps.step: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F). Line a 20-cm (8-inch) round cake pan with parchment paper.Melt together the butter with the chocolate (in a double-boiler or in the microwave, slowly and for just a few seconds at a time, blending with a spoon between each pass).
Transfer to a medium mixing bowl.
Add in the sugar, stir with a wooden spoon and let cool a little.
Add the eggs one by one, mixing well after each addition. Finally, add in the flour, if using, and mix well.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan, sprinkle the surface lightly with fleur de sel, and put into the oven to bake for 25 minutes, until the center is set.
Transfer to a rack to cool completely. Run a knife around the cake to loosen, then transfer to a serving dish.
